children.text: NATURAL OR ARTIFICIAL THREADS OR FIBRES; SPINNING
MECHANICAL TREATMENT OF NATURAL FIBROUS OR FILAMENTARY MATERIAL TO OBTAIN FIBRES OR FILAMENTS, e.g. FOR SPINNING
Mechanical separation of fibres from plant material, e.g. seeds, leaves, stalks
Mechanical removal of impurities from animal fibres
Hackling or heckling machines
Obtaining silk fibres or filaments
Other mechanical treatment of natural fibrous or filamentary material to obtain fibres or filaments
CHEMICAL TREATMENT OF NATURAL FILAMENTARY OR FIBROUS MATERIAL TO OBTAIN FILAMENTS OR FIBRES FOR SPINNING; CARBONISING RAGS TO RECOVER ANIMAL FIBRES
Treatment of vegetable material
Treatment of animal material, e.g. chemical scouring of wool
Carbonising rags to recover animal fibres
MECHANICAL METHODS OR APPARATUS IN THE MANUFACTURE OF ARTIFICIAL FILAMENTS, THREADS, FIBRES, BRISTLES, OR RIBBONS
Treatment of filament-forming or like material
Spinnerette packs; Cleaning thereof
Formation of filaments, threads, or the like
Wet spinning methods
Melt-spinning methods
Cooling filaments, threads or the like, leaving the spinnerettes
Stretch-spinning methods (finishing by stretching D02J 1/22)
while mixing different spinning solutions or melts during the spinning operation; Spinnerette packs therefor
Conjugate filaments; Spinnerette packs therefor
Core-skin structure; Spinnerette packs therefor
Collecting the newly-spun products
Physical treatment of artificial filaments or the like during manufacture, i.e. during a continuous production process before the filaments have been collected
Other features of manufacture
Complete machines for producing artificial threads
CHEMICAL FEATURES IN THE MANUFACTURE OF ARTIFICIAL FILAMENTS, THREADS, FIBRES, BRISTLES, OR RIBBONS; APPARATUS SPECIALLY ADAPTED FOR THE MANUFACTURE OF CARBON FILAMENTS
General methods for the manufacture of artificial filaments or the like
Addition of substances to the spinning solution or to the melt (addition of substances to viscose D01F 2/00)
Other agents for modifying properties
Monocomponent artificial filaments or the like of cellulose or cellulose derivatives; Manufacture thereof
from cellulose derivatives
Monocomponent artificial filaments or the like of proteins; Manufacture thereof
Monocomponent artificial filaments or the like of synthetic polymers; Manufacture thereof
from homopolymers obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
from polyolefins
from polymers of unsaturated nitriles, e.g. polyacrylonitrile, polyvinylidene cyanide
from copolymers obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
from mixtures of polymers obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds as major constituent with other polymers or low-molecular-weight compounds
of polyolefins
from homopolycondensation products
from polyamides (from polyamino acids or polypeptides D01F 6/58)
from polyesters
from polycarbonates
from copolycondensation products
from copolyesters
from mixtures of polycondensation products as major constituent with other polymers or low-molecular-weight compounds
of polyesters
Conjugated, i.e. bi- or multicomponent, artificial filaments or the like; Manufacture thereof
from synthetic polymers
with at least one polyolefin as constituent
with at least one polyamide as constituent
with at least one polyester as constituent
Artificial filaments or the like of other substances; Manufacture thereof; Apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture of carbon filaments
of inorganic material (from softened glass, minerals, or slags C03B 37/00; incandescent bodies F21H, H01K 1/00, H01K 3/00)
Carbon filaments; Apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture thereof
by decomposition of organic filaments
from pitch or distillation residues
Chemical after-treatment of artificial filaments or the like during manufacture
Recovery of starting material, waste material, or solvents during the manufacture of artificial filaments or the like
PRELIMINARY TREATMENT OF FIBRES, e.g. FOR SPINNING
Severing continuous filaments or long fibres, e.g. stapling
Roughening of fibres
Separating, e.g. sorting, fibres
Breaking or opening fibre bales
Opening or cleaning fibres, e.g. scutching cotton
Disintegrating fibre-containing articles to obtain fibres for re-use
Mixing, e.g. blending, fibres; Mixing non-fibrous materials with fibres
Carding machines or accessories; Card clothing; Burr-crushing or removing arrangements associated with carding or other preliminary-treatment machines
Silk-dressing machines
Combing machines
Combinations of machines, apparatus, or processes, e.g. for continuous processing
Feeding fibres to machines; Conveying fibres between machines
Lap-forming devices not integral with machines specified above
Lap- or sliver-winding devices, e.g. for products of cotton scutchers, jute cards, or worsted gill boxes
Arrangements for lubricating fibres, e.g. in gill boxes
Warning or safety devices, e.g. automatic fault detectors, stop motions
Hand tools for treatment of fibres
Treatment of oakum
Other preliminary treatment of fibres
SPINNING OR TWISTING
Spinning or twisting machines in which the product is wound-up continuously
Spinning or twisting machines in which the product is wound-up intermittently, e.g. mules
Ring-and-traveller arrangements
Drafting machines or arrangements
Spinning or twisting arrangements
for imparting permanent twist
Ring-and-traveller arrangements
Arrangements for replacing or removing bobbins, cores, receptacles, or completed packages at paying-out or take-up stations
for removing completed take-up packages and replacing by bobbins, cores, or receptacles at take-up stations; Transferring material between adjacent full and empty take-up elements
Arrangements for confining or removing dust, fly, or the like
Other common constructional features, details, or accessories

Warning or safety devices, e.g. automatic fault detectors, stop motions (warning or safety devices for filamentary material, not intimately associated with spinning or like machines B65H; safety devices of general application F16P; indicating devices of general application G08B)
Piecing arrangements
for two-for-one twisting machines
Hand tools
YARNS; MECHANICAL FINISHING OF YARNS OR ROPES; WARPING OR BEAMING
CRIMPING OR CURLING FIBRES, FILAMENTS, YARNS, OR THREADS; YARNS OR THREADS
Producing crimped or curled fibres, filaments, yarns, or threads, giving them latent characteristics
by twisting, fixing the twist and backtwisting, i.e . by imparting false twist
Devices for imparting false twist
using knife edges, e.g. heated knife edges, for edge crimping
using stuffer boxes
using grooved rollers or gear-wheel-type members
using jets or streams of turbulent gases, e.g. air, steam
by combining fibres, filaments, or yarns, having different shrinkage characteristics
Combinations of two or more of the above-mentioned operations or devices; After-treatments for fixing crimp or curl
Yarns or threads, e.g. fancy yarns; Processes or apparatus for the production thereof, not otherwise provided for
Yarns or threads characterised by the material or by the materials from which they are made
Blended or other yarns or threads containing components made from different materials
Threads containing metallic filaments or strips
Yarns or threads characterised by constructional features
Bulked yarns or threads, e.g. formed from staple fibre components with different relaxation characteristics
with characteristics dependent on the amount or direction of twist
Yarns or threads having slubs, knops, spirals, loops, tufts, or other irregular or decorative effects, i.e. effect yarns
Cored or coated yarns or threads (elastic yarns or threads D02G 3/22)
Threads in which fibres, filaments, or yarns are wound with other yarns or filaments (covering endless core threads with fibres by using open-end spinning techniques D01H 4/00)
Yarns or threads characterised by the purpose for which they are designed
Tyre cords
WARPING, BEAMING, OR LEASING
Creels, i.e. apparatus for supplying a multiplicity of individual threads
Warping machines
Beaming machines
Combined warping and beaming machines
Leasing
Methods or apparatus not provided for in groups D02H 1/00 to D02H 9/00, e.g. for cleaning the warp
Details of machines of the other groups of this subclass
FINISHING OR DRESSING OF FILAMENTS, YARNS, THREADS, CORDS, ROPES, OR THE LIKE
Modifying the structure or properties resulting from a particular structure; Modifying, retaining, or restoring the physical form or cross-sectional shape, e.g. by use of dies or squeeze rollers
Stretching or tensioning, shrinking or relaxing, e.g. by use of overfeed and underfeed apparatus, or preventing stretch (stretch spinning D01D 5/12)
Modifying the surface
Cleaning, e.g. removing dust, loose fibres, charred ends
Combinations, not covered by any one of groups D02J 1/00 to D02J 7/00, of processes provided for in such groups; Plant for carrying-out such combinations of processes
Heating or cooling the yarn, thread, cord, rope, or the like, not specific to any one of the processes provided for in this subclass
WEAVING
SHEDDING MECHANISMS; PATTERN CARDS OR CHAINS; PUNCHING OF CARDS; DESIGNING PATTERNS
Dobbies
Jacquards
Cam or other direct-acting shedding mechanisms, i.e. operating heald frames without intervening power-supplying devices
Leno or similar shedding mechanisms
Healds; Heald frames
Selvedge shedding mechanisms not forming part of main shedding mechanism
Shedding mechanisms not otherwise provided for
Pattern cards or chains
Card-punching apparatus
Methods or devices concerned with designing or making patterns, not provided for in other groups of this subclass
WOVEN FABRICS; METHODS OF WEAVING; LOOMS
Woven fabrics designed to make specified articles
Inflatable articles
Sack- or bag-like articles
Curtain heading tapes
Ladder tapes (ladder tapes for venetian blinds E06B 9/38)
Woven fabrics characterised by their shape
Selvedges
Woven fabrics designed to be resilient, i.e. to recover from compressive stress
Open-work fabrics
Double or multi-ply fabrics not otherwise provided for
Woven fabrics characterised by the special disposition of the warp or weft threads, e.g. with curved weft threads, with discontinuous warp threads, with diagonal warp or weft
Woven fabrics characterised by the material or construction of the yarn or other warp or weft elements used
the warp or weft elements being of stiff material, e.g. wire, cane, slat
woven to produce shapes or effects upon differential shrinkage
using scaffolding threads, i.e. threads removed after weaving
using stretchable or elastic threads (woven fabrics whose elastic or stretch properties are due to the manner of weaving D03D 17/00)
using threads having high or low coefficients of friction
using heat-resistant or fireproof threads
Woven fabrics having elastic or stretch properties due to manner of weaving
Gauze or leno-woven fabrics
Lappet- or swivel-woven fabrics
General weaving methods not special to the production of any particular woven fabric or the use of any particular loom; Weaves not provided for in any other single group
Woven fabrics not otherwise provided for
Woven pile fabrics
Hand looms
Lappet, swivel or other looms for forming embroidery-like decoration on fabrics
Multiple looms, i.e. two or more looms assembled together, whether or not they have mechanisms in common
Smallware looms, i.e. looms for weaving ribbons or other narrow fabrics
Circular looms
Pile-fabric looms
Looms not otherwise provided for, e.g. for weaving chenille yarn; Details peculiar to these looms
Looms with change-boxes
Looms with automatic weft replenishment
Looms in which bulk supply of weft does not pass through shed, e.g. shuttleless looms, gripper shuttle looms, dummy shuttle looms
wherein the weft itself is projected into the shed
Handling the weft between bulk storage and weft-inserting means
Measuring and cutting the weft
Details or constructional features not peculiar to looms of a particular type
Control of the tension in warp or cloth (cutting weft in looms with automatic weft replenishment D03D 45/00; loose reed stop motion D03D 51/18; construction of warp beam D02H)
Driving, starting, or stopping arrangements; Automatic stop motions
Automatic stop motions
AUXILIARY WEAVING APPARATUS; WEAVERS' TOOLS; SHUTTLES
Auxiliary apparatus combined with or associated with looms
Weavers' tools, e.g. knot-tying tools
Shuttles
BRAIDING; LACE-MAKING; KNITTING; TRIMMINGS; NON-WOVEN FABRICS
KNITTING
Weft knitting processes for the production of fabrics or articles not dependent on the use of particular machines; Fabrics or articles defined by such processes
Pile fabrics or articles having similar surface features
Non-run fabrics or articles
Patterned fabrics or articles
Other fabrics or articles characterised primarily by the use of particular thread materials
specially adapted for knitting goods of particular configuration
Hand tools or implements
Knitting apparatus or machines without needles for domestic use
Flat-bed knitting machines with independently-movable needles
Circular knitting machines with independently-movable needles
Straight-bar knitting machines with fixed needles
Circular knitting machines with fixed spring or bearded needles, e.g. loop-wheel machines
Details of, or auxiliary devices incorporated in, weft knitting machines, restricted to machines of this kind
Devices for supplying, feeding, or guiding threads to needles
Devices for determining or controlling patterns
Repairing knitted fabrics by knitting operations
Unravelling knitted fabrics
Warp knitting processes for the production of fabrics or articles not dependent on the use of particular machines; Fabrics or articles defined by such processes

Fabrics characterised by the incorporation by knitting, in one or more thread, fleece, or fabric layers, of reinforcing, binding, or decorative threads; Fabrics incorporating small auxiliary elements, e.g. for decorative purposes (pile fabrics D04B 21/00; non-woven fabrics in general D04H)
Flat warp knitting machines
Warp knitting machines not otherwise provided for
Details of, or auxiliary devices incorporated in, warp knitting machines, restricted to machines of this kind
Crocheting processes for the production of fabrics or articles
Crocheting tools or apparatus
Details of, or auxiliary devices incorporated in, knitting machines, not otherwise provided for
Auxiliary apparatus or devices for use with knitting machines
Knitting processes, apparatus or machines, not otherwise provided for
BRAIDING OR MANUFACTURE OF LACE, INCLUDING BOBBIN-NET OR CARBONISED LACE; BRAIDING MACHINES; BRAID; LACE
Braid or lace, e.g. pillow-lace; Processes for the manufacture thereof
Braiding or lacing machines
Twist or bobbin-net lace-making machines
Tools or apparatus for braiding or lacing by hand
TRIMMINGS; RIBBONS, TAPES, OR BANDS, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
Ropes or like decorative or ornamental elongated trimmings made from filamentary material
Chenille trimmings
Fringes
Decorative or ornamental textile articles
Ribbons, tapes, welts, bands, beadings, or other decorative or ornamental strips, not otherwise provided for
Ribbon-threading apparatus or devices
MAKING NETS BY KNOTTING OF FILAMENTARY MATERIAL; MAKING KNOTTED CARPETS OR TAPESTRIES; KNOTTING NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
Making nets by knotting of filamentary material
Making knotted carpets or tapestries
Other knotting
MAKING TEXTILE FABRICS, e.g. FROM FIBRES OR FILAMENTARY MATERIAL
Non-woven fabrics formed wholly or mainly of staple fibres or like relatively short fibres
from fleeces or layers composed of fibres without existing or potential cohesive properties
characterised by the use of certain kinds of fibres insofar as this use has no preponderant influence on the consolidation of the fleece
the fleeces or layers being consolidated by mechanical means, e.g. by rolling
by forming intermeshing loops or stitches from some of the fibres (knitting D04B; sewing D05B)
by needling or like operations to cause entanglement of fibres (D04H 1/45 takes precedence; needling machines D04H 18/00)
in combination with at least one other method of consolidation, e.g. with application of bonding agents
by welding together the fibres, e.g. by partially melting or dissolving (in combination with needling D04H 1/48)
in association with fibre formation, e.g. immediately following extrusion of staple fibres
by applying, incorporating, or activating chemical or thermoplastic bonding agents, e.g. adhesives (in combination with needling D04H 1/48)
the bonding agent being applied in wet state, e.g. chemical agents in dispersions or solutions
characterised by the method of forming fleeces or layers, e.g. reorientation of fibres (lap-forming devices D01G 25/00; paper web-making by wet methods D21F, D21H)
Non-woven fabrics formed wholly or mainly of yarns or like filamentary material of substantial length
characterised by the method of forming fleeces or layers, e.g. reorientation of yarns or filaments (lap-forming devices D01G 25/00; paper web-making by wet methods D21F, D21H)
characterised by the method of strengthening or consolidating
with bonds between thermoplastic yarns or filaments produced by welding
with bonds between thermoplastic filaments produced in association with filament formation, e.g. immediately following extrusion
Non-woven fabrics formed of mixtures of relatively-short fibres and yarns or like filamentary material of substantial length
Non-woven pile fabrics
Other non-woven fabrics
Felting apparatus
Needling machines
SEWING; EMBROIDERING; TUFTING
SEWING
General types of sewing apparatus or machines without mechanism for lateral movement of the needle or the work or both

with mechanisms for needle-bar movement

Linking machines, e.g. for joining knitted fabrics

Machines for sewing sacks
Machines for sewing leather goods
Sewing machines for concurrently making thread and welded seams
Programme-controlled sewing machines

Sewing machines with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam, e.g. programme-controlled for sewing collars, for attaching pockets
Sewing apparatus or machines not otherwise provided for
Sewing units consisting of combinations of several sewing machines
Work-feeding means
Pressers; Presser feet
Workpiece holders or hold-downs in machines for sewing leather
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for supplying or removing the work
Work-feeding or -handling elements not otherwise provided for
for facilitating seaming; Hem-turning elements; Hemmers
for attaching bands, ribbons, strips, or tapes or for binding
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for slitting, grooving, or cutting

Devices incorporated in sewing machines for lubricating, waxing, or colouring the threads

Devices for changing speed or for reversing direction of rotation

Covers, or portable enclosures, for sewing machines
Incorporations or adaptations of lighting equipment
Sewing machines incorporating devices serving purposes other than sewing, e.g. for blowing air, for grinding
Guards or like devices for preventing injury to operator
Needles
Needle-threading devices
Seam-ripping devices
Tools, implements, or accessories for hand sewing
Stitches; Stitch seams
Preparatory or finishing operations in connection with hand sewing
Hand sewing processes or apparatus for special work or not otherwise provided for
EMBROIDERING; TUFTING
Apparatus, devices, or tools for hand embroidering
General types of embroidering machines
Embroidering machines with arrangements for automatic control of a series of individual steps

Appliances for holding or feeding the base fabric in embroidering machines
Devices for guiding, feeding, handling, or treating the threads in embroidering machines; Machine needles; Operating or control mechanisms therefor

Making pile fabrics or articles having similar surface features by inserting loops into a base material
Embroidered or tufted products; Base fabrics specially adapted for embroidered work; Inserts for producing surface irregularities in embroidered products
TREATMENT OF TEXTILES OR THE LIKE; LAUNDERING; FLEXIBLE MATERIALS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
TREATING TEXTILE MATERIALS BY LIQUIDS, GASES, OR VAPOURS
Applying liquids, gases, or vapours on to textile materials to effect treatment, e.g. washing, dyeing, bleaching, sizing, impregnating
Passing of textile materials through liquids, gases, or vapours to effect treatment, e.g. washing, dyeing, bleaching, sizing, impregnating
Forcing liquids, gases, or vapours through textile materials to effect treatment, e.g. washing, dyeing, bleaching, sizing, impregnating
Mercerising, e.g. lustring by mercerising
Solvent-treatment of textile materials
Treatment of selected parts of textile materials, e.g. partial dyeing
Treatment of textile materials with liquids, gases, or vapours with aid of vibration
Removing liquids, gases, or vapours from textile materials in association with treatment of the materials by liquids, gases, or vapours
Storing of textile materials in association with the treatment of the materials by liquids, gases, or vapours
Treatment of textile materials by liquids, gases, or vapours, not provided for in groups D06B 1/00 to D06B 17/00
Successive treatments of textile materials by liquids, gases, or vapours

Component parts, details, or accessories of apparatus or machines, specially adapted for the treating of textile materials, not restricted to a particular kind of apparatus, provided for in groups D06B 1/00 to D06B 21/00
FINISHING, DRESSING, TENTERING, OR STRETCHING TEXTILE FABRICS
Stretching, tentering, or spreading textile fabrics; Producing elasticity in textile fabrics
Shaping or stretching of tubular fabrics upon cores or internal frames
Heating or cooling textile fabrics
Singeing
Teasing, napping, or otherwise roughening or raising pile of textile fabrics
Shearing, clipping, or cropping surfaces of textile fabrics; Pile cutting; Trimming seamed edges
Calendering, pressing, ironing, glossing, or glazing textile fabrics
Fulling
Breaking or softening of fabrics
Shrinking by compressing
Making patterns or design on fabrics
Treating selvedges or other edges, e.g. stiffening
Compound processes or apparatus, for finishing or dressing textile fabrics, not otherwise provided for
Finishing or dressing, of textile fabrics, not provided for in the other groups of this subclass
LAUNDERING, DRYING, IRONING, PRESSING OR FOLDING TEXTILE ARTICLES
Washing receptacles
Hand rubbing apparatus
Hand implements for washing purposes, e.g. sticks
Washing devices adapted to be used independently of any particular receptacle, e.g. for removable mounting on wash-tubs, bath-tubs, or the like
Brushing-type washing machines
Washing machines using rollers, e.g. of the mangle type
Washing machines having receptacles, stationary for washing purposes, with agitators therein contacting the articles being washed
Washing machines having beating, rubbing, or squeezing means in receptacles stationary for washing purposes
Washing machines having receptacles, stationary for washing purposes, wherein the washing action is effected solely by circulation or agitation of the washing liquid
Washing machines having receptacles, stationary for washing purposes, and having further drying means
Washing machines using vibrations for washing purposes
Washing machines with receptacles, e.g. perforated, having a rotary movement, e.g. oscillatory movement
Washing machines with receptacles, e.g. perforated, having a rotary movement, e.g. oscillatory movement, the receptacle serving both for washing and centrifugally draining

Washing machines with receptacles, e.g. perforated, having a rotary movement, e.g. oscillatory movement, the receptacle serving both for washing and centrifugally draining and having further drying means, e.g. using hot air
Washing machines with receptacles moving bodily, e.g. reciprocating, swinging
Combinations of a washing machine with other separate apparatus in a common frame or the like, e.g. with rinsing apparatus
Washing installations comprising an assembly of several washing machines or washing units, e.g. continuous flow assemblies
Controlling a series of operations in washing machines, e.g. programme-control arrangements for washing and drying cycles
electrically
Washing machines, apparatus, or methods not otherwise provided for
Details of washing machines of kinds covered by groups D06F 21/00 to D06F 25/00, restricted to machines of these kinds
Mountings, e.g. resilient mountings, for the rotary receptacle, motor, tub, or casing; preventing or damping vibrations (damping vibrations in general F16F)
Driving arrangements

Details of washing machines in so far as such details are not special to washing machines of groups D06F 21/00 to D06F 25/00 or to any particular type of washing machine defined in groups D06F 9/00 to D06F 19/00 or D06F 27/00
Devices for adding soap or other washing agents
Liquid supply or discharge arrangements (supplying liquid detergent D06F 39/02)
Casings; Tubs
Rinsing apparatus
Dry-cleaning apparatus using volatile solvents
Wringing machines with two or more co-operating rollers; Similar cold-smoothing apparatus
Apparatus of the press type for expelling water from the linen
Domestic spin-dryers or similar spin-dryers not suitable for industrial use
Apparatus for expelling or draining water from the linen, not provided for in groups D06F 45/00 to D06F 49/00
Clothes-lines; Supports therefor
Clothes-pegs
Supporting means, other than simple clothes-lines, for linen or garments to be dried or aired
Domestic laundry driers
having drier drums rotating about a horizontal axis
Details (controlling or regulating arrangements D06F 58/28)
Drying cabinets or drying chambers having heating or ventilating means
having heatable surfaces for contacting the laundry (D06F 59/00 takes precedence)
Detachable or door-mounted drying arrangements for washing machines
General details of domestic laundry driers (D06F 59/00 takes precedence)
Controlling or regulating (controlling or regulating in general G05)
Supports adapted to retain the shape of particular articles being dried, e.g. incorporating heating means
Ironing machines using two or more co-operating pressing rollers
Ironing machines having a roller or rollers coacting with a fixed or moving flat bed or table
Ironing machines with rollers rotating against curved surfaces
Details of ironing machines provided for in groups D06F 61/00, D06F 63/00, or D06F 65/00
Ironing machines not otherwise provided for

Apparatus for hot-pressing clothes, linen, or other textile articles, i.e. wherein there is substantially no relative movement between pressing element and article while pressure is being applied to the article; Similar machines for cold-pressing clothes, linen, or other textile articles
Apparatus for smoothing or removing creases from garments or other textile articles by formers, cores, stretchers, or internal frames, with the application of heat or steam
Hand irons
Hand irons internally heated by electricity
Arrangements for exerting pressure on, lifting, or guiding hand irons
Accessories for hand irons
Ironing boards
Coverings or pads for ironing or pressing members
Independent elements for interposition between the article and the ironing or pressing surface
Apparatus for moistening or otherwise conditioning the article to be ironed or pressed
Apparatus for folding textile articles with or without stapling
Starching apparatus
Counting, sorting, or marking arrangements specially adapted for laundry purposes
Laundry systems or arrangements of apparatus or machines; Mobile laundries
MECHANICAL OR PRESSURE CLEANING OF CARPETS, RUGS, SACKS, HIDES, OR OTHER SKIN OR TEXTILE ARTICLES OR FABRICS; TURNING INSIDE-OUT FLEXIBLE TUBULAR OR OTHER HOLLOW ARTICLES
Beating, brushing, or otherwise mechanically cleaning or pressure cleaning carpets, rugs, sacks, hides, or other skin or textile articles or fabrics
Turning inside-out flexible tubular or other hollow articles
Mechanical, vacuum, or pressure cleaning in combination with the turning inside-out of flexible tubular or other hollow articles
MARKING, INSPECTING, SEAMING, OR SEVERING TEXTILE MATERIALS

Inspecting textile materials
Seaming textile materials
Apparatus or processes for cutting, or otherwise severing, specially adapted for the cutting, or otherwise severing, of textile materials
PLEATING, KILTING, OR GOFFERING TEXTILE FABRICS OR WEARING APPAREL
Pleating, kilting, or goffering textile fabrics or wearing apparel
BLEACHING, e.g. OPTICAL BLEACHING, DRY-CLEANING, OR WASHING FIBRES, THREADS, YARNS, FABRICS, FEATHERS, OR MADE-UP FIBROUS GOODS; BLEACHING LEATHER OR FURS
Dry-cleaning or washing fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics, feathers, or made-up fibrous goods
Bleaching fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics, feathers, or made-up fibrous goods, leather, or furs
TREATMENT, NOT PROVIDED FOR ELSEWHERE IN CLASS D06, OF FIBRES, THREADS, YARNS, FABRICS, FEATHERS, OR FIBROUS GOODS MADE FROM SUCH MATERIALS

Physical treatment of fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics, or fibrous goods made from such materials, e.g. ultrasonic, corona discharge, irradiation, electric currents, magnetic fields; Physical treatment combined with treatment with chemical compounds or elements

Treating fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics, or fibrous goods made from such materials, with inorganic substances or complexes thereof; Such treatment combined with mechanical treatment, e.g. mercerising
Treating fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics or fibrous goods made from such materials with non-macromolecular organic compounds

Treating fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics or fibrous goods made from such materials with macromolecular compounds; Such treatment combined with mechanical treatment
with natural macromolecular compounds or derivatives thereof (with natural rubber or derivatives thereof D06M 15/693)
with synthetic macromolecular compounds (with synthetic rubber D06M 15/693)

with natural or synthetic rubber, or derivatives thereof
combined with mechanical treatment (decorating textiles D06Q)
Biochemical treatment of fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics, or fibrous goods made from such materials, e.g. enzymatic
Producing multi-layer textile fabrics
Treatment of feathers
Treatment of fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics or fibrous goods made from such materials, characterised by the process
